website_summaries.verdict: Fancy bamboo style that doesn't require fuel.
pros: Polycarbonate material means it will last year-round
Solar powered with one flickering LED that mimics natural flames
cons: Because these don't use fuel, they won't keep bugs away

customer_reviews.title: I love this product and have purchased it before--lights still work ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and have purchased it before--lights still work fine after six years of unrelenting Las Vegas sun, although plastic is now fragile/brittle from exposure. These are all plastic but are more durable than the torches that use the real bamboo strip webbing at the base of the torch light. The flickering light is also brighter than five-LED torches I purchased from a non-Amazon online vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Kmick46

customer_reviews.title: Cool lights
customer_reviews.text: These are great, they do look like they are actually lit tiki torches when the come on at night, which is so cool. The poles that these are on are a little chinsy since one of the push in stakes have already busted off and it feels like the post themselves may snap if you push on them too hard to get them into the ground. We are planning on digging little holes to bury them down into the ground better because they do not want to stand up completely straight. Other than that, these are really cool lights and are perfect accent lighting light a path to our pool/tiki bar area.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: First off these are great solar lights. They are bright, last all night, and the flicker is just right. The misleading part is I ordered the old style and got the new improved style which as it turns out really doesn't matter as they flicker the same. I wanted the color black and got chocolate brown, but at night you can't tell the difference. Now the bad, the older version lights came with very sturdy metal stakes and poles. Now they are cheaply made with plastic stakes and poles. All most impossible to put in the ground so beware.Newhouse needs to go back to metal.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to work fine, but I’m underwhelmed. For one, it just seems like a very cheap piece of plastic. Which, admittedly, it is. But still. It seems like they could have made an effort to make it seem a bit less cheesy. The poles and the ground spike are not sturdy. This thing probably blows over in a gust of wind. But worst of all, the light just looks like a flickering light. I have also tried other similar torches, and they actually look like a flame.
customer_reviews.author: Markus Egger

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, one of the two torches only works about once every 30 days, even after putting it in direct sunlight. No rhyme or reason why. The other light works more consistently (but still has its full sun days where it does not work) but its just too dim. The poles are also a bit flimsy and the ground stakes are not very robust (one snapped upon first use). Update: Neither work anymore. Total garbage and waste of money. Buy the TomTom ones.
customer_reviews.author: sdwildcat

customer_reviews.title: Stunning ambiance in wooded area
customer_reviews.text: I am totally in love with these tiki torches. I have a very dense canopy in my back yard yet all 20 torches glow for at least 8 hours. I happened on two of them still glowing at 6:30am this morning. 10 hours of glow time for solar lights is darn right respectable , particularly where there is little sunlight. I wish I could take a photo but it does them no justice. Decided I need 4 more to complete the look😊
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: Really looks like a flickering torch
customer_reviews.text: These perform much better than I expected. The flickering flame effect lasts almost all night long. The only thing I am concerned about is that the pole is plastic and when I was installing it I heard it crack a little. Nothing visible, I because they aren't metal, I would suggest being very gingerly in your your instillation to ensure you don't snap the pole. H
customer_reviews.author: Just My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Anyway you guys can make the color more red or orange like all the other torches
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 6 years in snow/rain- 365 days a year. They last about 3 years. The new version is way better than the old, but the flame is to Yellow. All the other torches out on the market are more of a orange/ red color and look more like a real flame. These would be 5 star if they would make them produce more of a red/orange color. Guys please change the color.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne  Estey

customer_reviews.title: These were super fun to have around for our bonfire
customer_reviews.text: These were super fun to have around for our bonfire. They charged for a day and stayed flickering through the night. We have them in storage for the winter, but are hoping they will be just as long lasting this coming summer. The stakes aren't very durable though. One broke when going into the semi-soft ground. The other three are ok, but we were very careful putting them in the ground and taking them out for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen F

customer_reviews.title: These are okay - but not as nice as our others
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and ended up using them in a 'background' section of our yard - because they are cheaply made and look very plastic. They are not very bright. I also bought some that were about three times the price, but made SO much better and look SO much better. These are okay if you don't look at them closely and they are in the background somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Romero

customer_reviews.title: consider these temporary
customer_reviews.text: I love the one that still works. They went strong for a year and I swear our restaurant sold a ton of these for Newhouse, because we were so happy: Solar,nice flame, no citronella. THEN, they dropped like flies. The environment wasn't tundra nor jungle and I cant figure out what went wrong. I had a couple working then they died again. I'd totally shell out more money for more if there was some sort of better h20 sealant for them? I'm not sure why they failed,
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smyth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! After one day none of them worked!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible horrible! I searched and searched for good solar tiki torches and finally decided on these. After unboxing, 2 of the torches glowed nicely, 1 a little, and 1 not at all. I figured they needed a charge and left them in the bright sun all day. At night, not even a flicker from the ones that were working previously! Frustrated. Don't buy these! Plus, they are really cheap looking as well. Complete fail
customer_reviews.author: Angelique B

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these February 2016. They worked great....little flickering lights at night....looked like tiki torch lights. (Yes...during the day they look like plastic poles but they’re lights...designed for night effect....duh). Anyway, now it’s exactly 2 years & only 2 are working. I bought new batteries but nothing after several days in the sun. Nice while it lasted. All solar lights need more work....they’re a great idea but the technology just isn’t there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie

customer_reviews.title: Plastic warps
customer_reviews.text: Installed one light straight and true. After one day in the Arizona sun it warped.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: all plastic, not wicker
customer_reviews.text: These looked wicker on the photos I viewed. They are hard molded dark caramel colored plastic. All of the ones on line now have many tiny LED lights so the flicker is very different from the older wicker ones. I do not know if the plastic will tolerate our high summer sun temps or the ice in the winter, the wicker could. They do hold a solar charge well. They, like all the others are way over priced. They came in nice boxes and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: helpful toolbox

customer_reviews.title: * LOVE *
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 5-stars because I really love these cute tiki torches. In the past we have bought these from Lowe's, but Lowe's no longer carries them that I can find. I was pleased to find them on Amazon, we have only had them now for a couple of months, but so far they are holding up well, and at night, they look like the real thing. I plan to order more. UPDATE: it is now almost October, and the tiki torches have held up well all summer long. We plan to take them down and store them during the winter, but we have had much pleasure and enjoyed them for the warm months!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Kisner

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent led tiki torches, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that they come with several extensions to tailor the length. They seem to be about a 7 on a scale of 0-10 as far as brightness. I bought these as a pack of 4, and glad I did, as they look better across my lanai with 4 mounted in 3/4" flagpole brackets, evenly spaced.
customer_reviews.author: John Plato

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap product
customer_reviews.text: This product is only good for a couple of nights. The lights were very dim and they didn't lasts very long. It was made from plastic but it looks decent. I bought this product because of the great reviews and now I am wondering if the reviews were really from the buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Joff

customer_reviews.title: More Like a Strobe Light Than a Flame--Not Really a Problem, They Only Stay Lit for an Hour!
customer_reviews.text: I bought four torches. One of them worked as advertised if it was a very sunny day. The other three were like strobe lights, not flames. But since the wouldn't stay lit for more than an hour, I didn't have to be bothered by the flashing lights in my backyard. Customer service was very prompt in their reply to my email. They sent me three replacements--none of them worked for more than an hour--same strobe light effect. The torches look realistic but the solar panels are inferior and so are the electronics. I've seen solar torches that are realistic that actually burn for 4-6 hours. The positive reviews about this product are not believable.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these items 4 months ago and today only 3 are working. I replaced the original ni-cad batts with lithium and they will still not recharge properly. These are a total waste of money. They are also cheaply made and fitment is poor. They look more like a light bulb being turned on and off rather than a flickering torch. So very disappointed and cannot reccomend this product. Try something else!
customer_reviews.author: Tom 3  Phx, Az

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiki Torches
customer_reviews.text: I have used these tiki torches around my HI property for years. While not emitting an abundance of light, they look real and hold up well to the elements. I would have given five stars, but they won't deliver to HI. That's strange, because tiki torches belong in HI. I had to ship first to my home in OR and the mail them to myself in HI. Doesn't seem necessary.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: A Little Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These are the most affordable set I found, but I don’t think these would last outside year round with our rowdy dogs and in storms (kind of thin, light and wobble around). The stakes all broke instantly, but I managed to get these in the ground with what was left. I only use these at Halloween, so it’s OK for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These work great , they look good. I’ve ya e only had them for a month so I don't know how long they last. They are not as bright as the ones I got from tiki a few years ago, so I was a little disappointed in that but still looks better than just a plain solar light
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: They really look like real torches
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th set! They really look like real torches. I recently had one torch go out so I contacted the manufacturer and within a week I had a replacement in the mail! Excellent product and company.
customer_reviews.author: LawrenceD

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our summer deck
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan if these solar tiki torches and have used them for years. This was a replacement set due to my others being weathered from multiple years use. They are hard plastic and some people may think they look to fake. At night you do not notice it and the flames flicker brightly. I would buy again tomorrow if I needed to. Well worth the price, very durable, and as close to the real thing as you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: These torches are so flimsy! Worried they will break with a wind gust. Definitely not good quality. Overpriced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Dearheart

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility for several heights! Beautiful realistic flame. High quality
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! Look like real tiki torches! I’m using them both at lowest and tallest height. Looks great both ways.
customer_reviews.author: Alegna M.

customer_reviews.title: They are a great addition or replacement to real Tiki Torches
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one set initially, and will be ordering a second set this Spring. They are a great addition or replacement to real Tiki Torches. They are solar powered, LED flickering flame torches. With the four of them, and a few similar Tiki lights, I no longer need to waste energy leaving my back porch light on! We had a blazingly hot Summer/Fall, and two of these that got direct sunlight ALL day, faded slightly. So, I would suggest placing them, where they get a few hours of sunlight...but not ALL day blazing sunlight. I have two REAL Tiki Torches to finish off the mood when I am enjoying an evening on my deck.
customer_reviews.author: 1Princess

customer_reviews.title: Uniform flicker rate...
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality is very good. The LED design does flicker, as advertised. But the flickering is always at a constant rate with no variation. To my eye, it looks artificial because of the uniform rate of flickering. I have seen LED-based candles with a random flicker pattern that look much more authentic. It would have been nice if they had used a random flickering design. I've given them away to a friend and went back to real flame-based Tiki torches.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Might as well have no light at all.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice looking but it would literally take a 100 or more to put off enough light to see anything, even enough to make it a romantic light setting and that is fully charged. Really a shame because it would be a nice alternative to fire teke torches.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Burns

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - just add rebar...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I added rebar at the base as other reviewers have mentioned to keep them stable. The plastic stakes they come with are too flimsy. They turn on like clockwork every night at dusk. They look really cool. They have survived a few California mountainside brief but torrential downpours and are no worse off. You can grab the top part of the pole and walk around with them like a cave woman. You don't have to worry about lighting the San Gabriel mountains on fire with these.
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t.
customer_reviews.text: The torches seemed really flimsy and not likely to hold up to any significant wind load. Ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L.

customer_reviews.title: patio solar lightd
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights on my patio. They work well and last a very long time.....Great value
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Rabeneau

customer_reviews.title: There are great light so far
customer_reviews.text: There are great light so far. I have had them in my garden for only a month but they are very nice looking. When I use all three attachments they are a bit long and sway. I only use two of the attachments and they look great. Using two also makes the lights a little more sturdy. I owned a different brand of these that i bought from Home Depot about five years ago and they feel and look about the same. These are very bright and use two batteries so they stay lit all night. They come on at the perfect time as well. Right when the sun is almost down the light come on, Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Jameson

customer_reviews.title: More of a blinking than a flickering
customer_reviews.text: These were a very well made product with a anjustable pole height. As much as I liked them, I did return them. The lights didn’t so much as flicker as they did blink. Unfortunately I couldn’t find a way to change it to a “steady” state.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Brice

customer_reviews.title: Plastic doesn't have UV protection
customer_reviews.text: Horrible plastic quality, the plastic will surely degrade and break within a year. Mine have only been out 2 months and the color has completely bleached out. All they needed to add was about 10 cents of UV inhibitor in the plastic. These are 3-LED lights, that are not very bright and the flickering is not realistic. But these are about the only ones made anymore. They have 2 low capacity NICD AA batteries included and seem to run late into the night. A few had defective batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in AZ

customer_reviews.title: It would be hard to design this any worse. A real disappointment as I had another brand ...
customer_reviews.text: These lasted from June till end of fall, this summer 6 out of eight failed. Plastic has faded, the solar cell on top has clouded up. The batteries have failed most likely from not charging. It is not weather resistant as water leaks around the solar cell, no gasket of silicone, just a piece of saran wrap inside to deflect the water around the electronics. It would be hard to design this any worse. A real disappointment as I had another brand that lasted over six years, these only about six months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I.

customer_reviews.title: These flickering solar lights look UBER cool in the back yard during the summertime
customer_reviews.text: These flickering solar lights look UBER cool in the back yard during the summertime! These are replacements for some I had out for 3 years straight, and they finally got brittle and broke apart. I'm going to bring them in every year now. They are very neat looking in summer evenings.
customer_reviews.author: P P

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS PORTRAYED
customer_reviews.text: The color is not as portrayed and so the torches do not look like they are bamboo. I was going for a tropical look in my backyard and the weird pinkish color of these torches destroys the effect. They are also way more expensive than other brands. For what they are charging for a replacement top, one could buy an entire torch elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: RoxyG

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I love the tiki torches. They were easy to put together and they look great on my patio, They lit up the first night and they look so lovely. However the second night one of them does not work anymore. I have thrown away the packaging so I could not send them back. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ach1952

customer_reviews.title: Great lights
customer_reviews.text: These lights are you great! After purchasing 2 sets last year, I purchased another set this summer for the grilling area. They stayed bright throughout the summer, winter, and spring. I have replaced the batteries only once in the first set. The battery quality it impressive.... they lasted one year and that's with being left outside throughout the winter months. I recently purchased the replacement batteries through Amazon at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy poles - one broken
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked and 1 out of 4 was in pieces - I hate having to repack (it was the last one) so I used Gorilla Glue to hold the top light part together. The poles are quite flimsy so we didn't use all 3 extensions - only used 2 and are using them shorter
customer_reviews.author: Kim Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing solar lights!
customer_reviews.text: Love these tiki lights! They stay bright and flicker all night long, even at 5:00 am, they will still be lit brightly while my other solar lights are no longer lit
customer_reviews.author: Donna Polster

customer_reviews.title: Work well, but a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These solar tiki torches hold an amazing charge and light up as soon as the sun starts to set and I often find them still lit up at 3 in the morning! There's no off switch so the battery charges all day and runs itself down overnight. I live in Hawaii so I get sun 90% of the time. I gave these 4 stars instead of 5 because they are a little flimsy. The plastic stake is pretty useless. I zip tied them to my fence posts. I don't recommend putting these up w/o fastening them to a fence post.... wind would surely blow them over if just driven into the ground alone. Overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: YogaMama

customer_reviews.title: Replacement needed!!
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that I can’t get replacements for the tops only as the solar patch clouds over and then doesn’t work. Why do I have to throw the whole thing away?? Can’t get a vendor to help me out.... Need follow up on purchased items.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny B

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 a few months prior to this 2nd set, and I loved them so much I decided to get 2 more. This 2nd set I received is unacceptable. One never worked and the other one worked for a little bit and then stopped working:(. I can’t find anywhere to contact the seller to get a replacement sent, so if they somehow accommodate me I will change this 1star review to a 5star because I do love how the 1st set looks and works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Sortino

customer_reviews.title: Tiki Time
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my fire pit. This is my 2nd order as my 1st one are getting to be 5 years old Some of the batteries in the new sets were not charging/holding charge. Replaced with another brand (Moonrays 47740SP Rechargeable NiCd AA Batteries) and now these go all night. 2 of these seem not to be charging.....
customer_reviews.author: tailu66

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: One of the tiki torches no longer works... I bought in September but didnt start using til December... in 4 months one of the torches are now useless!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Mostly work
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work as well as the old plastic ones I had. One just never held the charge and had to be replaced. Still, a really cool effect when they do work. When they stop, just get new rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Friendly reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome torch lanterns
customer_reviews.text: Even though the pole is a little cheap and weak the the lanterns themselves are beautiful and the solar flame lasts for more than 12 hours. They really look great out by our pool.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Safely Adds that tropical vibe
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. The torch on top is a little smaller than I wanted, but for the price, I settled. The torch flickers realistically, looks so nice after dark.
customer_reviews.author: Ali oops!

customer_reviews.title: Won't stand up straight
customer_reviews.text: They look nice in the night. BUT, they won't stand up straight. I couldn't even use all three sections of pipe included, because they were top heavy, and stood at an angle. So I only used two sections of pipe, but the top still bent over. The bottom piece of pipe would be straight, but the section above would bend to an angle. I contacted the company, and they said they have to be installed in ground that has lawn, not in a planting bed. Really???? I would love to return them, but don't have the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I ordered 3 sets of these (12 total) and only ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 sets of these (12 total) and only 8 worked the first day after charging them for 2 days. Within a few more days only 5 were left working. Returned all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Gayle Shore

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take advantage of natural and free sunlight (we live in florida). They are attractive and it does flicker like a flame but the light is not 'great', the oil burning ones are definitely a brighter light. They do offer an ambiance that is nice. A little more about the construction - they are a little flimsy so when it is windy we take them down. The 'stakes' they provide are not durable so we purchased the traditional metal tiki holders at a discount store. I had to re-glue the solar panel in one when it fell but it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: like them but no on/off switch??
customer_reviews.text: These are fun tiki lights for use camping but main complaint is that there is no 'On' / 'Off' switch so we actually have to remove the batteries when not in use or somehow place something between the battery connector to disable them, otherwise the lights just stay on when you go to store them! Can't believe they couldn't include a switch?
customer_reviews.author: annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lights
customer_reviews.text: We had one of the lamps that would die after less than an hour but Amazon sent out 4 replacements along with a shipping label to send these back. The worst part of the lights is the sectional poles, they have a habit of leaning. I used pipe glue and shoved them all the way in and that helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Dale & Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Re: Flicker Looks Fake
customer_reviews.text: >>>Never mind. I spoke too soon. Will conduct a better test tonight.<<< For the moment, please disregard the comment below: Years ago I bought some solar Tikis that looked just like these and they performed very well with a very realistic looking flicker. Eventually they wore out so I ordered these and the flicker is not at all realistic. The flicker looks fake/cheap -- to the garbage. Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Barton S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Light, weak ground stakes
customer_reviews.text: The light portion holds a charge very well. The plastic ground stakes are not made for windy conditions and snap off. Used metal poles from old tiki torches to secure them.
customer_reviews.author: MN Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: One of the stakes broke while removing it from the box.. such a shame... not a happy buyer the light is beautiful but they are too flimsy
customer_reviews.author: jade h.

customer_reviews.title: They are new improved brighter
customer_reviews.text: They brighter then the old style and they Flicker. Love these I have like 16 of them. They look really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Works well even in somewhat shaded areas
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to place in my backyard near a hot tub, was initially somewhat worried since the area is pretty shaded whether they would be able to charge sufficiently during the day, but they seem to do just fine. They are not especially bright, so if you need to really light up an area you might want some additional lighting (I put a couple of battery operated LEDs in the area to brighten things a bit more) but they look really nice at night and give a good atmosphere to the area.
customer_reviews.author: Echo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality...poles cheep sectioned plastic. Bend with weight of tourch. Too flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: Poles plastic and flimsy. They do not support torch head. Very expensive for plastic. Do not recommend. I have older model with metal poles and flickering bulbs; the lighting is just as esthetic, the poles are sturdy and stand taller as you do not have to but he 1/3 of the pole.
customer_reviews.author: David L Poulter

customer_reviews.title: Do not work
customer_reviews.text: I followed all of the instructions but the lights do no work unless you are solely relying on the batteries to power the lights up- the solar panels do not work. Highly disappotined and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great pool and patio solar torches
customer_reviews.text: I love these!! They set up in seconds and flicker all night giving off a natural torch light. What I don't like are the flimsy plastic stakes so I went to Home Depot in the section that has rebar and they have the perfect size 24" stake to secure these in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kathyv

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tiki atmosphere without the "fire"..
customer_reviews.text: Really fun solar lights! I purchased several of these and was not disappointed! I used them to show the pathway to the house we rented for our Hawaiian luau wedding reception. They really helped set the atmosphere of the event. They stayed lit the entire time and had many compliments. Will use the around my mothers pool for year round fun! Some of the lights were dimmer than others so would suggest you buy a backup set. I did not bother to return the dimmer ones only because I was satisfied nonetheless!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: ... some other brands and I think these are the best ones available today
customer_reviews.text: I tried some other brands and I think these are the best ones available today. If I need more tiki torches, I will get these again...I like to stick with a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great effect.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice. 1-2-3 easy assembly. No they dont throw off light but a nice flickering twinkle of light. Nice atmosphere.
customer_reviews.author: Juls

customer_reviews.title: The Best solar power bamboo tiki lights EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I've found two types of solar tiki lights. One light actually flickers and looks like a real flame. The other type flashes like a boat light. The boat light is not the effect I want. Well these light are the good ones. Wait they are GREAT! The lights are so realistic. Of all the solar tiki lights I've purchased these are The BEST! This lights look like a real flame. The solar battery holds it's charge and the lights stay on until sunrise. I am so very pleased with this purchase. Thank you to a great seller.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzy Blonde

customer_reviews.title: These replacements are just as awesome; I have them out in the front garden ...
customer_reviews.text: We had a set of these out on our lana'i here in Hawai'i, and they finally deteriorated from the sun and heat. These replacements are just as awesome; I have them out in the front garden and by the front door. I agree with some past reviews that said the flicker is a little "off"...it could have been made slower to look more like a flame, but if that is the worst thing about them...I can live with 'em! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thejeepguy

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: These Tiki Torches have added a nice tropical ambiance to my pool deck. I hope they last a while!
customer_reviews.author: B. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Too cute tikis
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy assembly. Nice, simple touch for the backyard. They look very pretty all lit up and flickering. Allow 24 hours in the sun to get a good charge and preserve your backup battery life. Cons: Kinda flimsy because they're plastic. We're hoping they fair well in the summer elements. Over all we're pleased.
customer_reviews.author: SMiller

customer_reviews.title: Replaceable batteries
customer_reviews.text: These are great lights. Finally a company that has replaceable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: DOMINIC BRACCO

customer_reviews.title: Fair deal
customer_reviews.text: Can not use the 3rd peace of the stake, it bends to much. The light flickers but not very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Poole

customer_reviews.title: BIGLOU
customer_reviews.text: YOU WILL LOVE THIS PRODUCT, LOOKS LIKE REAL FLAME AND LOOKS GREAT IN MY YARD
customer_reviews.author: BIGLOU

customer_reviews.title: These torches look so realistic!
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest ones I've seen or owned so far! Very realistic. Burns almost all night long. Easy to assemble as well. The price and quality make the a great buy. If I had anything to say negative, it would be that they lean somewhat, however, as another person who gave feedback suggested, was to use rebar staked into the ground for extra support! I didn't find it necessary bur do see the need if there were a lot of wind. I don't get that much wind where I am as the tree's block it. I have it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: These are nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the ones I purchased at Home Depot. The Home Depot item is made from plastic with a reed basket. The baskets fell apart after on year. These are all plastic so hopefully they will last a few years. One problem, Of the four I ordered, 1 torch does not flicker. A little annoying but I will still be ordering 8 more to put around our pool deck. They seem to get about the best reviews from customers who have bought them. We'll see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Derwent

customer_reviews.title: Flame light
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one season. It broke this spring when installing. Its very flimsy and cheap plastic. Looks real at night. I wish it was more rugged.
customer_reviews.author: QAEngineer a good critic

customer_reviews.title: 3 of the 4 worked but one didn't
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set of four. Set them all up, threw away the packaging and recycled the boxes and one of the four does not charge and light up. The other three are great but too much work to take them all apart and send back for refund after throwing all the packaging away .... bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Tiki house in Florida!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone comments, neighbors, on those "bright" tiki lights in the backyard. They give a really tiki feel to a Florida paradise. Each one is quite bright and really places a nice accent in the yard. Two of the tiki's are placed between two large areca palms and the give a nice flickering reflection to the palms, I ordered another set as I enjoyed the first one so much.
customer_reviews.author: Ev

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights they are too cool. They light up very quickly and they last for a long time. I may buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. Huffstetler

customer_reviews.title: Great Ambiance
customer_reviews.text: The torches look almost like the real thing and stay lit from dusk to dawn. These solar torches work very well where I reside as we cannot have open flames. Hope they last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Ridgeman

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: These lights are very nice. I ordered a set of four and then reordered another set. They add a nice soft glow to the camp fires at night. I broke a tip off one of the anchors (no fault but my own) I contacted customer service to order a replacement and received it within the week. No questions asked. Very nice to work with. Highly recommend these lights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Posts
customer_reviews.text: product went together easily. however the stakes an posts are plastic and very flimsy. if you want something sturdier look elsewhere. also not black as pictured but dark brown.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Love them but thought they would be wood and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them but thought they would be wood and they are just plastic. I bought another brand from Home Depot years ago and even are bamboo and was cheaper than these. I wouldn't have bought these if I found the same ones at Home Depot again. These ones do work well which is awesome. But plastic isn't what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Louie-Palacios

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love these torches. Such a nice look in the evening. I've had many compliments on how they flicker. And, they are much better than the first set I purchased elsewhere that were bamboo and lasted a short time whereas these are sturdy. I put them away for the winter and bring them out for the summer. This is my second year with these and they still look like new even in the hot GA sun.
customer_reviews.author: B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two sets n one arrived with wrong parts so not able to assemble
customer_reviews.author: wei li

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to yard
customer_reviews.text: I like these as you can make them tall or short. My only complaint is lack of brightness but that is to be expected for solar lights.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these for my patio. They look nice during the day, but they hardly light up at night at all. They get full sun most of the day and then flicker dimly for about an hour after sunset and then they are out. One hardly lights up at all. Very disappointed. My parents used to have similar torches around their pool years ago and the lights would stay on almost all night. That is what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Hall

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what happened but these showed up with cloudy solar panels. There was no way they would get a good charge that way, so I had to return them. Honestly, even if the panels weren't damaged (or whatever they were) they looked pretty cheap and flimsy. Granted, I didn't put them together so maybe I didn't quite get the "full picture" but I don't think I would have been happy with the purchase either way.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. S

customer_reviews.title: Bought 8 and None Worked
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. These look very stylish and matched our outdoor furniture. Unfortunately when we set them up, none worked. No way to return them so we have 8 lovely sticks planted in the yard without lights.
customer_reviews.author: OnlyGal16

customer_reviews.title: I bought 4 of these and only got one to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and only got one to work and it only lasts a couple of hours. The instructions say to pull the battery insulator tabs, but there are none! There is plastic between the electrical circuit and the batteries. I tried pulling that out, but it just tears. The one I did get work, I was able to get the plastic out. Junk, junk, junk!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Becker

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we have ever purchased for our trailer!!!
customer_reviews.text: These rock!!!!! We have had them for years! We use them camping, beachside, or in the backyard! Highly recommend them! No messy oil, no refills, environmentally friendly!!!! Just stake them down, let them charge, and enjoy!!'
customer_reviews.author: L. L.

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect and we get so many comments from people who ...
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing these torches. We have them along our riverfront property in NY and just bought them for our beach property in FL. They are perfect and we get so many comments from people who think they are real torches!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie from ADK

customer_reviews.title: they finally died but love the new ones
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we've ordered them for around our pool. The first time was a few years ago, and after time in the weather and salty air, they finally died but love the new ones! They look really good at night.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: That they stay lit at night
customer_reviews.text: Love these torches! Bought 2 sets, ordering 4 more. Don’t know how long they will last, because I just got them today. Look really pretty, without the worry of fire or oil.
customer_reviews.author: margaret hoger

customer_reviews.title: Love them. I have them for a year now ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them. I have them for a year now and still working despite harsh climate (winter). Yes, I recommended this product and would buy again from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice flickering glow.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these a year ago, and they're still going strong! In fact, I was looking to purchase more! I hope they're not discontinued. They give off a very nice flickering glow, late into the evening.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with them at all
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these.. Didn't last for long.. Batteries are extremely hard to get out to charge. Ripped my knuckles a few times trying.. Batteries only stay charged for 2 days and then I have to remove and re-rip open my knuckles again to charge again to last for another 2 days.. BTW I bought an 8 pack of rechargable batteries with these also..Not happy with them at all..
customer_reviews.author: jamie murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great lights...if you replace the poles
customer_reviews.text: Bought eight for around the pool. The lights themselves are fantastic but the poles are worthless. They are flimsy and bend easily. Had to buy poles from hardware store and create new ones. UPDATE: 6 months later and none of the lights (I purchased a total of 10) are still working. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Cheap low light and completely decorative
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty big a disappointment. I was hoping to use these in place of real torches. They are about 1/50 of the brightness of a tea light flame. Completely decorative and have no real use as a light. They are also pretty cheap looking so better viewed from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

product_meta.title: Newhouse Lighting FLTORCH2 LED Island Torch Solar-Powered Flickering Dancing Flame Effect, Waterproof Outdoor Landscape Lighting, Bamboo Finish , 2-Pack
product_meta.description: Style:New Improved Flame| Size:2-Pack| Color:BambooCreate the perfect tropical island atmosphere with the Newhouse Lighting Solar Island Torches! These great-looking torches are powered by the sun so you can have an awesome looking space without the hassle of traditional torches. There are no dangerous flames or oils to mess with, simply put together the poles and place where you like for a mood-enhancing glow. The dusk-to-dawn functionality automatically turns your torches on when dusk hits and back off again when it's light out. Includes 2 island torches and 4 Ni-Cd batteries.
feature_bullets: REALISTIC DANCING FLAME DESIGN: Beautiful LEDs cast a safe, mood-enhancing glow that is much safer than real flames. Flickering effect looks just like a real flame!
SOLAR LIGHTS: No more messing with messy oils or wicks! These easy-to-use solar torches are quick to install and powered completely by the sun.
EASY TO INSTALL: No wiring required! Simply attach the included poles to the torch head and place wherever you like. Looks great in the yard or garden, or by pools, patios, fences or decks.
DUSK-TO-DAWN LIGHTING: These torches automatically turn on when the sun goes down and turn off when it's light.
SATISFACTION : Be confident with your purchase knowing this product is backed by a 1 year limited against manufacturer defects.

specifications.Included Components: Rechargeable Torch Tops, Plastic Housing, Poles, Stakes
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,230 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
